title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 6-1.1 - Corporations required to file reports
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 6-1.1 - Corporations required to file reports

State Regulations
(Tax Law, section 211(1))

Reports are required to be filed annually by: (a) every corporation subject to tax, regardless of the amount of its business income, capital or receipts; (b) every receiver, referee, trustee, assignee or other fiduciary, or other officer or agent appointed by any court
that conducts the business of any corporation subject to tax under article
9-A; (c) every corporation that
continues in business after it is dissolved; and
(d) every taxable domestic international
sales corporation (DISC). Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
6-1.1

Adopted

New

York State Register December 27, 2023/Volume XLV, Issue 52, eff. 12/27/2023

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
